bibl.title: Letter from Son to My dear Mother
Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, June 25, 1899

div1.p: Lazear thanks Sweitzer for providing so much help. He discusses his lodgings and his work at the hospital.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, June 25, 1899
div1.opener:
DR. JESSE W. LAZEAR,
835 PARK AVE.
OFFICE HOURS,
4.30-6 P. M.
BALTIMORE. June 25 99
My dear Mother-
div1.p:
Mabel has written me how
delighted she is with the quarters you have
secured for her. It was awfully nice
of you to do so much for us. I wish
it was time for me to go. I am getting
along very well here. It is a little
difficult to get out for dinner at half
past six. Aunt Kate returned yesterday.

Mabel has told you of Alex' intended trip.
Perhaps you can think of some information
which would be of value to him.

Please send Madame Gratrix' address.
He may be able to run over to Paris.
I am in your room, and find your
table and chair very convenient.
I think it is the most comfortable room
in the house. My work at the hospital,
goes on very well I am working in the
Throat Department every afternoon and am
making very good progress in the subject.
